description: The humorous clip sees Mike Jones, of Smithville, in Monroe County, Mississippi, staying very quiet while mimicking his daughter's dance moves and later throwing in some of his own steps.
title: Father of two girls practising the Whip/Nae Nae sneaks up behind them in video
title_page: Father of two girls practising the Whip/Nae Nae sneaks up behind them in video | Daily Mail Online
text:
and both shout 'dad' in
ones of his own
A dad 'videobombed' his two daughters dancing the Whip/Nae Nae in a clip that has taken the internet by storm.
The video, which has amassed just shy of a whopping 19 million views, was captured by Terry Delk Blaylock in the town of Smithville, in Monroe County, Mississippi.
The video shows Mike Jones sneaking up behind his two daughters as they prepare to show off their moves while dancing to popular Silento track Watch Me (Whip/Nae Nae).
Shh! Dad Mike Jones gestures to his mother to stay silent while sneaking up behind his daughters
Watch Me! Mike begins upstaging his daughter's performance with some incredibly athletic moves
Mike, who wrestles with Outlaw Wrestling Organization under the name Studd, then begins upstaging their performance with some incredibly athletic steps.
The humorous clip sees him staying very quiet while mimicking their hand gestures before he later throws in some of his own moves.
Eventually his daughters sense his presence behind them and turn around to find him shaking his behind with much enthusiasm.
The video concludes with the girls shouting 'dad' disapprovingly before laughing as he continues to dance along to the track.
The dad stays very quiet while mimicking the dance moves and later throwing in some of his own steps
The Northeast Mississippi Daily Journal reported that Mike's daughters, aged 12 and 10, often record their dance routines in the kitchen.
Mike told the paper that after peeking his head around the door he spotted his mother filming the two girls and decided to sneak up behind them.
In the video you can see the wrestler gesturing to his mother to stay silent with a finger to the lips.
Mike said he has been contacted from people across the world since the video went viral, the paper reported.
The humorous video amassed just shy of a whopping 19 million views since first appearing online
The dancing dad has also received nearly 2,500 friend requests and an excess of 10,000 messages on Facebook.
As expected the video has received a number of comments in addition to the millions of view it has received since first appearing online.
One viewer wrote: 'I just laughed so loudâ€¦ Greatness,' while many others suggested that the clip should be featured on The Ellen DeGeneres Show.
